chapter.title: Thieves

row.entry: 7 piles of 5 cards, face up. The remaining cards face down in a pile, with one removed and placed face up next to it.

chapter.para: To remove as many cards as possible.

The face up card can be matched with a card at the top of a pile if it is numerically adjacent to it (aces are low), or either is a joker. The card it is matched with is placed on top of the face up card, and the game continues.
If desired, you can move a card from the top of the face-down pile to the face-up pile.
In order you get, 8, 6, 6, 4, 4, 2, 2, 2, 4, 4, 6, 6, 8 for each type of card.. No points are scored for jokers.
Since you can see all the cards at the top, try to engineer `runs', to try and get rid of as many cards up there as possible, as you only have a finite supply of backup cards.
This game is quite boring really.
